svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
October 19, 2024" date: "2024-10-18"
Eth News and Links
Eth R&D protocol call (All Core Devs)
* Consensus layer focused protocol call (ACDC #144): Pectra upgrade: Spec refinement
discussions Blob increase: Base blob increase proposal presented: target 5, max 8
blobs engine_getBlobsV1 initial results : bandwidth reduced for download but increased
for upload EIP7742 uncouple blob count between CL/EL: makes changing blob count
easier, consensus layer teams support scheduling for inclusion, review on next week's
call with execution layer teams EIP7783 controlled gas limit increase EIP7782 reduce
slot time to 8s : 2-4s would be more attractive option, needs more analysis, could
conflict with future potential upgrades
* Pectra upgrade: Spec refinement discussions Blob increase: Base blob increase
proposal presented: target 5, max 8 blobs engine_getBlobsV1 initial results :
bandwidth reduced for download but increased for upload EIP7742 uncouple blob count
between CL/EL: makes changing blob count easier, consensus layer teams support
scheduling for inclusion, review on next week's call with execution layer teams
Pectra upgrade:
* Spec refinement discussions
Spec refinement discussions
* Blob increase: Base blob increase proposal presented: target 5, max 8 blobs
engine_getBlobsV1 initial results : bandwidth reduced for download but increased for
upload EIP7742 uncouple blob count between CL/EL: makes changing blob count easier,
consensus layer teams support scheduling for inclusion, review on next week's call
with execution layer teams
Blob increase:
* Base blob increase proposal presented: target 5, max 8 blobs
Base blob increase proposal presented: target 5, max 8 blobs
* engine_getBlobsV1 initial results : bandwidth reduced for download but increased for
upload
* EIP7742 uncouple blob count between CL/EL: makes changing blob count easier,
EIP7742 uncouple blob count between CL/EL: makes changing blob count easier, consensus
layer teams support scheduling for inclusion, review on next week's call with
execution layer teams
* EIP7783 controlled gas limit increase
EIP7783 controlled gas limit increase
* EIP7782 reduce slot time to 8s : 2-4s would be more attractive option, needs more
analysis, could conflict with future potential upgrades
EIP7782 reduce slot time to 8s : 2-4s would be more attractive option, needs more
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade
* Pectra-devnet-4 : launched; 20% offline (10% Grandine & 10% Erigon)
Pectra-devnet-4 : launched; 20% offline (10% Grandine & 10% Erigon)
* Weekly testing call #9 : fusaka-devnet-0 planned for ~2 weeks time & ssz-devnet-0
launched
Weekly testing call #9 : fusaka-devnet-0 planned for ~2 weeks time & ssz-devnet-0
* EIP2537 BLS precompiles: Feedback wanted on planned EIP2537 usage & need for
subgroup checks EIP2537 BLS breakout : discussed removing subgroup checks &
precompiles are underpriced
EIP2537 BLS precompiles:
* Feedback wanted on planned EIP2537 usage & need for subgroup checks
Feedback wanted on planned EIP2537 usage & need for subgroup checks
* EIP2537 BLS breakout : discussed removing subgroup checks & precompiles are
underpriced
EIP2537 BLS breakout : discussed removing subgroup checks & precompiles are
Fusaka (Osaka + Fulu) upgrade
* PeerDAS breakout #10 : continuing to debug peerdas-devnet-3, unfinalized for over a
week
PeerDAS breakout #10 : continuing to debug peerdas-devnet-3, unfinalized for over a
* EOF implementers call #60 : discussed ERC721 support using EXTCODE/HASCODE, EXT*CALL
return codes and EOFCREATE hashing
EOF implementers call #60 : discussed ERC721 support using EXTCODE/HASCODE, EXT*CALL
Layer 1
* Giulio Rebuffo (Erigon): proposal to raise the gas limit via EIP7783
Giulio Rebuffo (Erigon): proposal to raise the gas limit via EIP7783
* ProbeLab Hermes : GossipSub listener & tracer for libp2p
ProbeLab Hermes : GossipSub listener & tracer for libp2p
* Péter Szilágyi: Geth prototype of ExEx (Reth Execution Extensions)
Péter Szilágyi: Geth prototype of ExEx (Reth Execution Extensions)
* Ephemery testnet incentives for genesis validators, infrastructure & client
implementations
Ephemery testnet incentives for genesis validators, infrastructure & client
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 28% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 28% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 37% & Lighthouse 33.4% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean
loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 37% & Lighthouse 33.4%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37% & Lighthouse 33.4%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Besu v24.10.0 : adds support for blobs in multiple transactions to
engine_getBlobsV1 and Ephemery testnet support Prysm v5.1.2 : hotfix for v5.1.1 to
recover from panic; v5.1.1 : experimental state enabled by default and adds IDONTWANT
support
Consensus layer:
* Besu v24.10.0 : adds support for blobs in multiple transactions to engine_getBlobsV1
and Ephemery testnet support
Besu v24.10.0 : adds support for blobs in multiple transactions to engine_getBlobsV1
* Prysm v5.1.2 : hotfix for v5.1.1 to recover from panic; v5.1.1 : experimental state
enabled by default and adds IDONTWANT support
Prysm v5.1.2 : hotfix for v5.1.1 to recover from panic; v5.1.1 : experimental state
* Execution layer: Nethermind v1.29.1 : improved memory usage on Linux and improved OP
Stack sync Teku v24.10.2 : hotfix for v24.10.x preventing startup on Windows
Execution layer:
* Nethermind v1.29.1 : improved memory usage on Linux and improved OP Stack sync
Nethermind v1.29.1 : improved memory usage on Linux and improved OP Stack sync
* Teku v24.10.2 : hotfix for v24.10.x preventing startup on Windows
Teku v24.10.2 : hotfix for v24.10.x preventing startup on Windows
Layer 2
* World Chain (OP Stack rollup) open to public
World Chain (OP Stack rollup) open to public
* Fuel Ignition (FuelVM) live, UTXO based
Fuel Ignition (FuelVM) live, UTXO based
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7788 : Dynamic target blob count
Informational EIP7790 : Parameter recommendations for controlled gas limit increase
strategy
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
* EIP7788 : Dynamic target blob count
EIP7788 : Dynamic target blob count
* Informational EIP7790 : Parameter recommendations for controlled gas limit increase
* RIPs (rollup improvement proposals): RIP7789 : Cross rollup contingent transactions
RIPs (rollup improvement proposals):
* RIP7789 : Cross rollup contingent transactions
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7786 : Cross-chain messaging gateway ERC7787 :
Soulbound degradable governance
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7786 : Cross-chain messaging gateway
ERC7786 : Cross-chain messaging gateway
* ERC7787 : Soulbound degradable governance
ERC7787 : Soulbound degradable governance
Stuff for developers
* Underhanded Solidity contest : Gerard Persoon solo winner with fallback from
transient storage
Underhanded Solidity contest : Gerard Persoon solo winner with fallback from transient
storage
* OpenZeppelin Contracts v5.1 : adds P256 & RSA signature validation; MerkleTree,
CircularBuffer & Heap data structures; StorageSlot, ReentrancyGuardTransient &
SlotDerivation utilities; updated Arrays, Base64, CREATE2, Strings & Math
OpenZeppelin Contracts v5.1 : adds P256 & RSA signature validation; MerkleTree,
* Guide to invariant testing using Recon Builder for scaffolding a Foundry project
Guide to invariant testing using Recon Builder for scaffolding a Foundry project
* Echidna v2.2.5 : adds Cancun support, warns if an assert isn’t hit in assert mode,
adds cheat codes and collects coverage during deployment
Echidna v2.2.5 : adds Cancun support, warns if an assert isn’t hit in assert mode,
* Pcaversaccio white hat frontrunning : Bash script using Foundry cast & chisel to
secure funds from compromised wallets
Pcaversaccio white hat frontrunning : Bash script using Foundry cast & chisel to
Security
* Radiant Capital $50M exploit on Arbitrum & BSC via compromised devices of 3/11
signers; revoke approvals on all chains
Ecosystem
* Vitalik on Ethereum improvements being considered: Proof of Stake (the Merge) :
single slot finality, 1 ETH staking, single secret leader election, faster transaction
confirmations, 51% attack recovery, increasing quorum threshold for finality and
quantum resistance Scaling (the Surge) : data availability sampling, data compression,
generalized Plasma, maturing L2 proof systems, cross-L2 interoperability and scaling
L1 execution
Vitalik on Ethereum improvements being considered:
* Proof of Stake (the Merge) : single slot finality, 1 ETH staking, single secret
leader election, faster transaction confirmations, 51% attack recovery, increasing
quorum threshold for finality and quantum resistance
Proof of Stake (the Merge) : single slot finality, 1 ETH staking, single secret leader
election, faster transaction confirmations, 51% attack recovery, increasing quorum
threshold for finality and quantum resistance
* Scaling (the Surge) : data availability sampling, data compression, generalized
Plasma, maturing L2 proof systems, cross-L2 interoperability and scaling L1 execution
Scaling (the Surge) : data availability sampling, data compression, generalized
* Propose Devcon satellite events
Propose Devcon satellite events
Job Listings
* Sigma Prime is hiring Rust developers and security engineers. Remote roles !
Sigma Prime is hiring Rust developers and security engineers. Remote roles !
* Executive Director for Enterprise Ethereum Alliance
Executive Director for Enterprise Ethereum Alliance
* Nethermind: Sr Dev (Rust, Go) & Sr Contract Auditor (Rust)
Nethermind: Sr Dev (Rust, Go) & Sr Contract Auditor (Rust)
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 5.3 to 111.8 gwei, 16.4 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 24.3 gwei 6k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 5.3 to 111.8 gwei, 16.4 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.3 gwei
Gas: 5.3 to 111.8 gwei, 16.4 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.3 gwei
* 6k ETH net issuance this week
6k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,436 - $2,671, currently $2,641, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,436 - $2,671, currently $2,641, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.039 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.039 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
* dGEN1 (mobile device): runs ethOS, ships 2025, pre-order via mint on Base
dGEN1 (mobile device): runs ethOS, ships 2025, pre-order via mint on Base
* Towns : gated group chats using River & Base
Towns : gated group chats using River & Base
* Trump promoted World Liberty Financial token sale
Trump promoted World Liberty Financial token sale
General
* FBI arrested alleged SEC Twitter SIM swapper
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-october-19-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Oct 25-27 – ETHSydney hackathon
Oct 25-27 – ETHSydney hackathon
* Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
* Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
* Dec 6-8 – ETHIndia hackathon
Dec 6-8 – ETHIndia hackathon
Sign up to receive this newsletter weekly
Week in Ethereum News
